message: I'm still new to HN, so hope I posted everything properly. Basically, my professor just launched a site and I'd like to make more people aware of it–would appreciate fellow Convorees (Convirites? Convorers?) in spreading the word about it.

Oh, and although biased, I genuinely think this project has a wonderful goal. I personally don't speak any of those languages, but when I try to imagine being someone who does, I readily realize how hard it would be to connect with similar users. That is, it's hard enough to find people when you all speak English, let alone one of these minority languages. If you guys think there was a better way to post that on HN, I'd appreciate tips for the future!
@koopa58 Ooh, nice idea! Just pinged him with it
Cool idea, I found it nice to see my first language there (Frysk) :) Maybe it would be nice to have a google map per language that indicates where people tweet from or generally are located.
@kioopi Aha, of course! It seems so obvious now!
Luxembourgish should be in that list too ;)
@sczon He has data for that language, so just pinged him to put in your request :)

That's from http://borel.slu.edu/crubadan/stadas.html by the way–so about 500 languages he can support, though he did mention to me he's avoiding the "big" languages for now as well as those that have serious language ID problems (e.g., Cebuano vs. Tagalog)
Woah, ReadWriteWeb just wrote about it! http://www.readwriteweb.com/archives/using_twitter_to_preserve_minority_languages.php
@sczon No problem! Hope it gets processed and added soon for you!
